channel.title: Speeding up my pc?
channel.description: Yo, here's the low-down. Had the pc for 2 years, used to run fast, runs like shit now. What can I do to it, excluding buying new components?

item.title: Speeding up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“c|p, post:12, topic:367840”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=463985.msg3394266#msg3394266 date=1289183988]
What a horrible idea that was. Also, windows filesystems seem to fragment quite a bit, and Linux filesystems don’t.
[/quote]

spoiler: ext still fragments[/quote]

Not really, not much at all. All filesystems will fragment somewhat, but after years of heavy use, the most fragmented ext hard drive that I own is about 2% fragmented.

Read full topic

item.title: Speeding up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

my windows pc is running strong after 4 years. i recommend uninstalling msvs 2005. that seemed to be the only issue ive ever had

Read full topic

item.title: Speeding up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’d say one of the main reasons windows systems slow down over time is the registry. What a horrible idea that was. Also, windows filesystems seem to fragment quite a bit, and Linux filesystems don’t.

Anyway, if you want to switch to Linux that will give you an immediate speed up, or if you reformat and re-install windows that will speed it up slightly as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Speeding up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Thug-life:

Purely because they’re better operating systems.

This.

Thug-life:

Though, I’m such a freak that I go well out of my way to ensure my Windows installation is free of shit and secondary drives are defragmented (Primary drive is SSD) so I don’t suffer from than same issue anymore. Windows doesn’t force defrag by default does it? I can’t remember, because I do it trigger them manually myself, because if not, that could be one of the more likely reasons.

This as well. I can’t stand a slow system that is full of shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Speeding up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well no, Linux and Mac don’t seem to suffer from it slowing down over time as drastically as Windows does it. Purely because they’re better operating systems.

Though, I’m such a freak that I go well out of my way to ensure my Windows installation is free of shit and secondary drives are defragmented (Primary drive is SSD) so I don’t suffer from than same issue anymore. Windows doesn’t force defrag by default does it? I can’t remember, because I do it trigger them manually myself, because if not, that could be one of the more likely reasons.

Other than that, software developers for Windows seem to love sticking everything into start up services, even when it isn’t needed.

Read full topic

item.title: Speeding up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Radeon:

While they’re at it, can someone explain the iFag theorem that states all windows pcs slow down with time while macs don’t.

This. Someone explain.

[quote=“goatee, post:1, topic:367840”]Yo, here’s the low-down.
Had the pc for 2 years, used to run fast, runs like shit now. What can I do to it, excluding buying new components?[/quote]
Either give it a nice clean up or reinstall your OS. Its probably being clogged up with rubbish.

Although afaik most computers in general will slow down over time if not kept ‘clean’. Most systems will slow, old computers run old software nicely but over time, updating to new software that is resource intensive and therefor making it seem slower. This isn’t always the case as you can find some examples(inb4 moparisthebest or linux or ruby) that will be fine.

Most of the shit comes from a few idiots who didn’t spring clean their PC every-now-and-again then bought a Mac and said PCs are shit. Computers are shit only if you treat them like shit. So it comes from the idiots of the iCult society who are idiots. Damn it…

Read full topic
